description: “Bird on a Wire,” Tony Palmer’s 1974 documentary of Mr. Cohen’s 1972 European concert tour, will be shown at Film Forum.
title: Listen to Leonard Cohen, More than 40 Years Ago
title_page: Listen to Leonard Cohen, More than 40 Years Ago - The New York Times
text:
The singer and songwriter Leonard Cohen, as seen in “Bird on a Wire,” Tony Palmer’s 1974 documentary of Mr. Cohen’s 1972 European concert tour, is a far cry from the wise old sage he became in his later years. Back then, the voice that later developed into a forbidding sepulchral drone was closer to the folk croon of Paul Simon.
Mr. Cohen’s attitude in the film, which opens Wednesday, Jan. 18, at Film Forum and was never released theatrically in the United States, is by turns quizzical, amused and courtly. Insecure about his voice, Mr. Cohen lacks all grandiosity and politely endures press interviews. When the sound system breaks down in the middle of a concert in the Netherlands, he is besieged by fans demanding their money back and invites them onstage with him.
Some of the early classics Mr. Cohen is heard singing are “Avalanche,” “Suzanne,” “Story of Isaac,” “Famous Blue Raincoat” and “So Long, Marianne.”
